page.title: 11INTERVIEW WITH WILSONS (2)
page.content: During the war{Mr. Wilson}worked as a cook in the army while{Mrs Wilson}had to put up with the rations provided. They could only have a bit of food each week and they used clothes tokens for buying clothes. During the war,blackout time,a warden used to come round to make sure no lights were showing.There was no actual bombing in sabden itself during the war and the nearest bomb fell in{ {Clayton. } It was very dark in the streets during those days as only{26}gas lamps were provided in the whole village. Before the war there were iron bars round every garden but they were all pulled up to make planes for the war and if you look now you can still see where they have been pulled up. {JULIA PRENDERGAST CATHERINE SMITH {
